trans-unit.source: Creates an ActiveX control in the GUI.

seg-source.mrk: Creates an ActiveX control in the GUI.

target.mrk: Creates an ActiveX control in the GUI.

trans-unit.source: A variable pointing to a previously opened object

seg-source.mrk: A variable pointing to a previously opened object

target.mrk: A variable pointing to a previously opened object

trans-unit.source: The left side of the control. If -1 is used then left will be computed according to GUICoordMode.

seg-source.mrk: The left side of the control.
If -1 is used then left will be computed according to GUICoordMode.

target.mrk: The left side of the control.
If -1 is used then left will be computed according to GUICoordMode.

trans-unit.source: The top of the control. If -1 is used then top will be computed according to GUICoordMode.

seg-source.mrk: If -1 is used then top will be computed according to GUICoordMode.

target.mrk: If -1 is used then top will be computed according to GUICoordMode.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The width of the control (default is the previously used width).

seg-source.mrk: The width of the control (default is the previously used width).

target.mrk: The width of the control (default is the previously used width).

trans-unit.source: [optional] The height of the control (default is the previously used height).

seg-source.mrk: The height of the control (default is the previously used height).

target.mrk: The height of the control (default is the previously used height).

trans-unit.source: the identifier (controlID) of the new control.

seg-source.mrk: the identifier (controlID) of the new control.

target.mrk: the identifier (controlID) of the new control.

trans-unit.source: This function attempts to embed an 'ActiveX Control' or a 'Document Object' inside the GUI.

seg-source.mrk: This function attempts to embed an 'ActiveX Control' or a 'Document Object' inside the GUI.

target.mrk: This function attempts to embed an 'ActiveX Control' or a 'Document Object' inside the GUI.

trans-unit.source: Not every control can be embedded. They must at least support an 'IDispatch' interface.

seg-source.mrk: Not every control can be embedded.
They must at least support an 'IDispatch' interface.

target.mrk: Not every control can be embedded.
They must at least support an 'IDispatch' interface.

trans-unit.source: See the Obj/COM Reference for more information about Objects.

seg-source.mrk: See the Obj/COM Reference for more information about Objects.

target.mrk: See the Obj/COM Reference for more information about Objects.

trans-unit.source: 'Document Objects' will only be visible if the Windows style $WS_CLIPCHILDREN has been used in GUICreate().

seg-source.mrk: 'Document Objects' will only be visible if the Windows style $WS_CLIPCHILDREN has been used in GUICreate().

target.mrk: 'Document Objects' will only be visible if the Windows style $WS_CLIPCHILDREN has been used in GUICreate().

trans-unit.source: The GUI functions GUICtrlRead() and GUICtrlSet have no effect on this control. The object can only be controlled using 'methods' or 'properties' on the $ObjectVar.

seg-source.mrk: The GUI functions GUICtrlRead() and GUICtrlSet have no effect on this control.
The object can only be controlled using 'methods' or 'properties' on the $ObjectVar.

target.mrk: The GUI functions GUICtrlRead() and GUICtrlSet have no effect on this control.
The object can only be controlled using 'methods' or 'properties' on the $ObjectVar.
